intro: Textoria dentigera, commonly known as the toothed textoria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its distinctive toothed leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
